notes.data_standards: All modules are designed for ADaM (Analysis Data Model) standard datasets following CDISC guidelines
notes.total_modules: 37 functional modules across multiple categories: Graphics (13), Tables (23), Analysis (2)
notes.extraction_methodology: Information extracted directly from function signatures in official PDF documentation, distinguishing required parameters (no defaults) from optional parameters (with defaults)

common_required_patterns.analysis_specific: dataname required by 81% of modules (30/37), arm_var required by 70% (26/37)
common_required_patterns.endpoint_specific: paramcd required by 51% of modules (19/37) for filtering specific analysis endpoints
common_required_patterns.patient_profile: Patient profile modules (tm_g_pp_*, tm_t_pp_*) typically require only label, with other parameters having defaults

common_default_patterns.parent_dataset: Most modules default parentname to ADSL using conditional logic: ifelse(inherits(arm_var, "data_extract_spec"), teal.transform::datanames_input(arm_var), "ADSL"). However, since arm_var is expected to be choices_selected(), this condition always evaluates to FALSE, making parentname effectively always default to 'ADSL' except for tm_g_ci.
common_default_patterns.confidence_levels: Statistical modules default to conf_level = teal.transform::choices_selected(c(0.95, 0.9, 0.8), 0.95, keep_order = TRUE)
common_default_patterns.variable_selection: Variables selected using teal.transform::choices_selected with teal.transform::variable_choices for dynamic selection
common_default_patterns.table_formatting: Table modules use teal.widgets::basic_table_args() for default formatting
common_default_patterns.plot_dimensions: Graphics modules typically default: plot_height = c(700L, 400L, 5000L), plot_width = c(1200L, 800L, 3000L)
common_default_patterns.totals_and_missing: Table modules commonly default: add_total = TRUE, total_label = default_total_label(), na_level = default_na_str()
common_default_patterns.output_customization: Most modules default: pre_output = NULL, post_output = NULL for content insertion flexibility

dataset_relationships.primary_parent: ADSL serves as the primary parent dataset, used in 97% of modules (36/37)
dataset_relationships.child_datasets: Analysis-specific child datasets linked via USUBJID to ADSL parent
dataset_relationships.usage_frequency: ADAE (~12 modules), ADLB (~10 modules), ADTTE (~4 modules), ADRS (~3 modules)

parameter_conventions.required_definition: Parameters without defaults in function signature = truly required, must be explicitly specified
parameter_conventions.optional_definition: Parameters with defaults = optional, will use documented default if omitted
parameter_conventions.dynamic_defaults: Most defaults use teal.transform functions for dynamic variable selection based on dataset content

verification_notes.tm_g_ci_confirmed: tm_g_ci verified: required_params=[label, x_var, y_var, color], datasets=[ADSL, ADLB] as specified
verification_notes.extraction_accuracy: All information extracted directly from function signatures and examples in official documentation
verification_notes.parameter_types_corrected: Corrected 36/37 module parameter types from 'data_extract_spec' to 'choices_selected' based on official documentation review. Only tm_g_ci legitimately uses data_extract_spec.
verification_notes.legacy_conditional_logic: The parentname defaults containing 'ifelse(inherits(arm_var, "data_extract_spec"), teal.transform::datanames_input(arm_var), "ADSL")' are legacy code from when clinical modules originally used data_extract_spec parameters. Since the architecture change to choices_selected(), this condition always evaluates to FALSE (except for tm_g_ci), making the teal.transform::datanames_input(arm_var) branch dead code. The parentname effectively always defaults to 'ADSL' for 36/37 modules.
verification_notes.tm_g_ci_exception: tm_g_ci is the ONLY clinical module that actually uses data_extract_spec parameters (x_var, y_var, color), making it an exception to the standard choices_selected() pattern used by all other 36 clinical modules
verification_notes.architectural_difference: Clinical modules (36/37) use choices_selected() for simple selection with sensible defaults, while general modules use data_extract_spec() for complex filtering/reshaping scenarios. tm_g_ci bridges both patterns as a hybrid module.
